skill.name: implementing-code
skill.description: Implements code changes and creates commits. Triggered when: implementation tasks, code changes, feature additions, bug fixes.
skill.summary: Implements code changes and creates commits. Triggered when: implementation tasks, code changes, fea...
skill.author: 1gy

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill definition file (SKILL.md) with no executable code. The skill defines workflow for implementing code changes using standard Claude tools (Read, Write, Edit, Glob, Grep, git). No network calls, no external scripts, no credential access, no persistence mechanisms.

content.value_statement: Need to implement features or fix bugs. This skill provides a structured workflow for investigating code, making changes, and creating conventional git commits.
actual_capabilities: Investigate related code using Glob and Grep
Create commits using Conventional Commits format
limitations: Does not push commits to remote repositories
Does not create branches or pull requests
Requires git to be initialized in the project

use_cases.title: Feature implementation
use_cases.description: Add new features following project conventions and create properly formatted commits

use_cases.title: Bug fixes
use_cases.description: Investigate existing code and implement bug fixes with clear commit messages

use_cases.title: Code refactoring
use_cases.description: Refactor code while maintaining consistency and creating descriptive commits

prompt_templates.title: Basic implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the implementing-code skill to add user authentication with email and password. Deliverable: Login form and validation.

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix
prompt_templates.prompt: Use implementing-code to fix the memory leak in the data processing module. Deliverable: Pass all existing tests.

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring
prompt_templates.prompt: Use implementing-code to refactor the utils module to use TypeScript types. Deliverable: Type-safe functions.

prompt_templates.title: Complex feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Use implementing-code to implement the dashboard with charts and data tables. Deliverable: Complete dashboard view with mock data.

output_examples.input: Implement a user profile page with name and email fields
output: Commit: feat: Add user profile page with name and email

best_practices: Provide clear deliverables with specific acceptance criteria
Review existing code patterns before implementing
Use conventional commit format for clear changelog history
anti_patterns: Providing vague deliverables without clear scope
Making changes without investigating existing patterns

faq.question: Does this skill push commits to remote?
faq.answer: No, this skill only creates local commits. Use a separate skill or command to push.

faq.question: What commit formats are supported?
faq.answer: Uses Conventional Commits format: feat, fix, docs, refactor, test, chore.

faq.question: Can I use this with any git provider?
faq.answer: Yes, works with GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, and any git hosting service.

faq.question: Is my code safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, changes are made locally. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: What if multiple changes conflict?
faq.answer: The skill detects parallel execution and reports conflicts to the manager.

faq.question: How is this different from manual git commands?
faq.answer: Provides structured workflow with investigation, implementation, and proper commit messages.
